Homeworks 1 – 11
Homework
HOMEWORK 1

Foundations of Probability

Introductory ideas, events, basic rules, and first formal reasoning about randomness.

HOMEWORK 2

Randomness & Simulation

Simple Monte Carlo experiments and empirical exploration of probability laws.

HOMEWORK 3

Combinatorics & Distributions

Counting arguments, binomial models, and discrete distributions derived from first principles.

HOMEWORK 4

Sampling & Variability

Samples, empirical distributions, and how variability appears when data are collected repeatedly.

HOMEWORK 5

Location & Dispersion

Mean, median, quantiles, variance, and the role of outliers and skewness in summarizing data.

HOMEWORK 6

Online Statistics

Incremental computation of mean and variance with Welford’s method, tailored to streaming data.

HOMEWORK 7

Stochastic Processes

Discrete-time trajectories, probabilistic evolution, and visualization of random paths.

HOMEWORK 8

Confidence & Inference

Confidence intervals, uncertainty quantification, and interpretation of inferential results.

HOMEWORK 9

Regression & Modelling

Linear relationships between variables, fitting lines, and basic diagnostic reasoning.

HOMEWORK 10

Counting Processes

Simulating a Poisson-like counting process on [0,1] and connecting discrete models to continuous-time theory.

HOMEWORK 11

Stochastic Differential Equation Simulation

Exploring continuous-time randomness through the simulation of Wiener processes and general SDEs using Euler–Maruyama.
